* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* changes the datetime string input to a simpledateformat object
* centralised so that can be standardized accross tasks.
* Parser class takes care of strings from single line commands.
* adds relevant tasks into the tasklist
public Parser(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* takes user input and makes corresponding task object to be put inside tasklist.
* @param str single line from user input
public String parse(String str) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! Events require both a description and a date /at");
//if it reaches here it is successful
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! Deadlines require both a description and a date by");
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
throw new DukeException("Input cannot be empty!");
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry,Please enter the date in the format dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm");
* reads the file and re-adds the tasks back into a new arraylist to be.
Task deadline = new Deadline(splited[2], new DateTime(splited[3]));
Task event = new Event(splited[2], new DateTime(splited[3]));
System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry,Please enter the date in the format dd-MMM-yyyy HH:mm");
* writes the tasks inside the tasklist into the txtfile.

public String addDeadline(String description, DateTime datetime) {
* deletes task by its integer number on the listview.
return ui.printTab("Noted. I've removed this task: \n"
+ "    " + current.toString() + "\n     Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* accesses the task through its position on the list to change state as done.
return ui.printTab("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + "    " + current.toString());
* goes through tasklist to find if there is a task containing
return ui.print("    Here are the matching tasks in your list: \n"
* Ui class handles everything to do with printing to console and formatting strings.
+ "     What can I do for you?\n"
public String printMsg(Task t, int size) {
return ("     Got it. I've added this task: \n"
+ "      " + t.toString() + "\n     Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
return(addDoubleLine("     Bye. Hope to see you again soon!"));

<fx:root alignment="TOP_RIGHT" maxHeight="1.7976931348623157E308" maxWidth="1.7976931348623157E308" prefWidth="400.0" type="javafx.scene.layout.HBox" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/8.0.171" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1">

<AnchorPane maxHeight="-Infinity" maxWidth="-Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="400.0" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/8.0.171" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1" fx:controller="MainWindow">
<TextField fx:id="userInput" layoutY="558.0" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="324.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" />
<Button fx:id="sendButton" layoutX="324.0" layoutY="558.0" mnemonicParsing="false" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="76.0" text="Send" />
<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" hbarPolicy="NEVER" hvalue="1.0" prefHeight="557.0" prefWidth="400.0" vvalue="1.0">
